intro: Campylandra lichuanensis, commonly known as the Lichuan campylandra, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
